alert.note: Alert for Southeast Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 3:17PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Aroostook County through 400 PM EDT... At 317 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Island Falls, or 16 miles southwest of Houlton, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Island Falls, Amity, Haynesville, Cary Plantation, Reed Plantation, Linneus, Oakfield, Cary, Dyer Brook, Orient, Glenwood, Forkstown and North Amity. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
